content.description: Climb the juggy flake or lieback your way to the top. Alternatively, you can jam this things at the same grade but with increased pain and fun.
content.location: The obvious and chalked flake in the center of this boulder.
North side of the Pearl Boulder

content.description: The Pearl is a classic line on The Pearl boulder.  The face is slightly overhanging, and the start holds barely there.  The original start is standing up with left hand in a pocket and right hand lower on a ledgy crimp (which has now broken and can still be used as a decent sidepull).  It's really only a move or two until you are home free.  Descent is on the opposite side of the boulder.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter are nice, but the crux move(s) are low.
content.location: See photo to check out the line, and the boulder description for directions.

content.description: This is a sit start to the classic problem "The Pearl V4" You start matched on the obvious crimp rail and then make a move left to a 1 or 2 finger pocket depending on the size of your fingers. From here continue up The Pearl. The crux is figuring out how to get the correct feet to make the first move.
content.protection: One crash pad is all you need. The fall is straight down and clean

content.description: Start with hands on good ledge, and dyno to lip.  Can be done static but what fun is that.  Given V4 in the Jenson guide but seems kinda soft.
content.location: Around the corner and to the right of The Pearl and The Clam Bumper.

content.description: Climb the center face on very sharp but positive holds.
content.location: In the middle of the Northeast Face of The Pearl boulder.

content.description: Start standing on the ramp and use holds that seem to be all facing the wrong way to topout.  Given V4 in the Jenson guidebook, but if The Pearl is the standard V4, this is less.
content.location:
Just to the right of The Pearl. 

The Pearl is the center line of chalked up holds on a slightly overhanging face. The Clam Bumper (supposedly also V4 but nowhere near as cruxy as The Pearl) is another route just to the right that starts on the ramp and moves up through the other chalked holds on the right side of this photo.

content.description: Start same as Clam Bumper, Go out left to the juggy crack, then move right to nice jugs and an easy top-out
A casual warm-up route on The Pearl.

The Pearl is a big block of sandstone with several V4 ish climbs on it.  You walk right by the slightly overhanging east face on the main east-west trail.  The Pearl V4 is the classic climb on the rock.  It gets pretty hot in the summer as the sun hits it full force but cools off after the sun goes west.  Not to be missed if you spend a day at the Kraft Boulders.
